Ring Fit Adventure has received a rare, substantial discount at Best Buy. Normally $80, the Switch-exclusive fitness game that makes unique use of the Joy-Con controllers, is on sale for only $50. This is just one of numerous Nintendo Switch exclusives discounted to remarkably low prices.

Check out the list below for Switch deals at Best Buy. We expect all of these offers to sell out fairly quick.

Released in 2019, Ring Fit Adventure is a fitness-based adventure game that features a special controller, the Ring-Con, and a leg strap to track players' movements. Players do things like jog in place, squeeze the ring, and perform yoga poses to defeat enemies and advance through the campaign. There are also an assortment of minigames to play outside of the campaign.

Ring Fit Adventure is a legitimately good exercise tool and a fun game. A lot of people seemingly picked the game up during the pandemic, as it's one of the Switch's best-selling games ever, with more than 15 million copies sold.

item.title: Players Push Back Against League Of Legends Character's Arcane Makeover
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/players-push-back-against-league-of-legends-characters-arcane-makeover/1100-6528263/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The recently concluded Arcane animated series on Netflix is one of the best advertisements for League of Legends that Riot Games could have hoped for. But some fans are already voicing their displeasure over aspects from Arcane spilling into the game, particularly with the new look for Viktor.

The new models debuted on the test servers in November, with implementation in the main game expected to occur next week. Prior to the changes, Viktor's in-game portrayal depicted him as a larger and more imposing figure than the new Viktor character model. The updated version of Viktor is inspired by his portrayal in the show, and he now has a much thinner body shape. Riot Games has already modified the latest designs for Viktor in response to the negative feedback, but that hasn't been enough to settle the issue yet. The following video illustrates some of the differences between the new Viktor skins and the old ones.

After their initial makeovers, the Deathsworn Viktor and Creator Viktor skins were modified to more closely reflect Viktor's previous in-game appearance without fully walking back the changes made to his model. So far, the hardcore Viktor fans--especially the ones who paid for the original skins--don't appear to be satisfied by those adjustments. Subsequently, Riot's Paul Bellezza stated on X/Twitter that the developer is "looking at making some adjustments to Viktor's update based on your feedback."

Quick update on Arcane Fractured Jinx and Viktor’s update:
We’re adding Jinx’s iconic finale hood to her first form (Hero of Zaun) in Patch 14.24. You won’t see it in PBE, but it’ll be live when the Patch launches. We should’ve had it in from the start, but hope you enjoy the… pic.twitter.com/rLoYAdqcXS

— Paul Bellezza (@RiotPabro) December 4, 2024

Earlier this year, Riot announced that League of Legends is introducing a seasonal model starting in January 2025. Riot also acknowledged the fan outrage over the controversial Immortalized Legend Ahri skin that was available for $250-$450. Outside of the game, a report suggested that Avengers: Endgame directors Joe and Anthony Russo were paid $5 million after their plans to make a live-action League of Legends movie fell apart.

item.title: Snap Up New Pokemon Snap For $25 At Best Buy Before It Sells Out

Best Buy has a phenomenal deal on New Pokemon Snap for Nintendo Switch. The long-awaited sequel to the N64 classic is on sale for only $25. This $35 discount isn't likely to stick around for long. The same goes for Best Buy's Fire Emblem Engage $20 deal and the handful of other Switch games on sale for new low prices at Best Buy.

Nintendo Switch Exclusives For Low Prices

  • Ring Fit Adventure -- $50 ($80)
  • New Pokemon Snap -- $25 ($60)
  • Splatoon 2 -- $16 ($60)
  • Bayonetta Origins: Cereza and the Lost Demon -- $25 ($60)
  • Fire Emblem Engage -- $20 ($60)
  • Miitopia -- $25 ($50)
  • WarioWare: Get It Together -- $16 ($50)
  • Super Mario RPG -- $38 ($60)

Technically an on-rails shooter--but with digital film for ammo--New Pokemon Snap is all about research and discovery as you dive deep into varied Pokemon ecosystems. Each Pokemon isn't just vividly detailed, they're also lively and display behaviors that are just begging to be captured on film.

Going back for extra runs opens up new areas of study for those particular Pokemon biomes, as well as a fascinating glimpse at just how different those areas in either during the daytime or at night. Nintendo released free post-launch content that added new zones to explore, more research titles to earn, and additional Pokemon to photograph.

As an added bonus if you own a Fujifilm printer for smartphones, you can take those photos from your Switch into the real world and even customize them with a wide range of Pokemon-themed decorations.

"20 years later, taking photos of Pokemon in the wild remains as fun and exhilarating as it always was, and though it's been a long time coming, New Pokemon Snap was worth the wait," Jenae Sitzes wrote in her New Pokemon Snap review.

item.title: Forza Motorsport Is About To Get Much Better Looking, If You Have The Hardware For It
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/forza-motorsport-is-about-to-get-much-better-looking-if-you-have-the-hardware-for-it/1100-6528261/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nvidia has revealed that Forza Motorsport will be getting a new PC-only update on December 9 that adds ray-traced global illumination lighting (RTGI) to further enhance the game's already-stunning visuals.

Basically, RTGI uses existing illumination technology to compute more accurate indirect lighting and occlusion across tacks and cars in real-time. As a result, the game's hyper-realistic graphics are even more impressive. This extends to every aspect of the game, including gameplay, cinematics, and photo mode.

RTGI can be turned on by setting the "Raytracing Quality" option to "Full Reflections + RTGI," and then choosing a quality level under "RTGI Quality." The feature will surely require high-end hardware and impact your frame rate, so Nvidia suggests enabling either DLSS or DLAA to help compensate.

The Forza series has been utilized by Nvidia many times to show off new graphical technology. Last year, Nvidia added DLSS 3 support to Forza Horizon 5.

Forza Horizon 4 is also being delisted and removed from Game Pass later this month on December 15, so be sure to grab it while you still can.

In GameSpot's Forza Motorsport review, we said, "Forza Motorsport is a triumphant return for the simulation racing series, and it has never been as approachable or rewarding."

item.title: Warcraft 2's First Balance Patch In Over 20 Years Nerfs Game's Most Overpowered Ability
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/warcraft-2-first-balance-patch-in-over-20-years-nerfs-its-most-op-ability/1100-6528260/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warcraft 2: Tides of Darkness, first released in 1995, just received its first balance update in over two decades, nerfing units like Ogre Mages and buffing Archers and Axe Throwers.

Blizzard recently remastered Warcraft 2 (and its predecessor) as part of a new Warcraft Remastered Battle Chest in celebration of the franchise's 30th anniversary. Far from simply updating the game's visuals and adding some modern quality-of-life features, Blizzard is also taking a look at gameplay balance.

Most of the changes in the new Warcraft 2: Remastered patch 1.0.1 are related to resource costs and ability durations for various units. Archers and Axe Throwers have received some significant changes to their upgrades, which are now faster to research, deal more damage, and cost less gold and (in most cases) lumber to learn. Paladins have received some slight buffs, as have Death Knights.

One huge change players seem happy with is a nerf to the Ogre Mage's Bloodlust ability, long regarded as overpowered for those playing as the Horde and an ability without a good Alliance alternative. The ability doubles the damage and piercing damage of a selected unit for a set duration, allowing Bloodlusted units to cut through even heavily armored foes with ease.

Post-patch 1.0.1, Bloodlust has had its duration decreased, its mana cost increased, and had its double-damage buff applied after armor reduction instead of before. The ability will still be extremely valuable, but it's at least not quite as omnipotent as before.

These balance changes are the first major gameplay updates to the beloved RTS since the arrival of patch 2.02 for the 1999 Battle.net version of Warcraft 2. I wasn't able to find an exact date for when 2.02 released, but given the Battle.net version of Warcraft 2's October 1999 release, it likely came a few months later or sometime in 2000. That makes the Warcraft 2: Remastered balance changes the first for the RTS in roughly 24 or 25 years.

Outside of the balance changes, the update additionally re-adds the game's classic Victory/Defeat screens and animations, adds an Alliance menu for online multiplayer, introduces countdowns to matches when waiting in a multiplayer lobby, and more.

Classic game storefront GOG recently announced Blizzard would be pulling the non-remastered versions of Warcraft 1 and 2 from sale on December 13. Despite the fact they will soon be delisted, GOG said it would continue to provide tech support for both games to ensure compatibility for future versions of Windows.

item.title: Caves Of Qud Finally Launches Today After 15 Years Of Development
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/caves-of-qud-finally-launches-today-after-15-years-of-development/1100-6528256/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Developer Freehold Games announced that Caves of Qud, a roguelike open-world RPG, will exit early access and into 1.0 today, December 5, at 9 AM PT / 12 PM ET. The game entered early access on Steam on July 15, 2015, but Freehold Games stated that it had actually been 15 years since development started.

The 1.0 version of Caves of Qud launches with the Dromad deluxe edition, as well as a tutorial and the last story quest with multiple endings. The Dromad deluxe edition includes some new features, including an enhanced soundtrack and the Pets of Harvest Dawn DLC pack that unlocks some in-game pets at the start of the game. For those who already own Caves of Qud, the soundtrack and the DLC pack can be purchased separately.

Unfortunately, save files prior to 1.0 will not be compatible with the full version of the game. However, players can continue playing their old saves on the 208.x legacy branch, which can be switched to from the Betas menu in Steam.

Caves of Qud will cost $30, but there's a 15% launch discount until December 12. Freehold Games is also holding a speedrunning contest for streamers today to celebrate the launch. Those who can beat the game as quickly as possible will be able to win Caves of Quid prize packs.

Freehold Games also said that it plans to keep supporting Caves of Qud with post-launch content after the release of 1.0, and will share those details in a future update.

item.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle Spoilers Have Been Leaked
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-spoilers-have-been-leaked/1100-6528259/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

One of the year's most highly anticipated games, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, gets early access tonight at 4 PM PT / 7 PM ET for those who bought the Premium or Collector's Edition, but some players got their hands on an earlier release. Leaked gameplay first appeared on YouTube on Thursday, showing the game’s first three hours.

Even though the video, posted by YouTuber Lone Viking, was eventually taken down by ZeniMax, some of the game's plot points were revealed. Lone Viking said that he purchased the game from a local store, where he paid $80-$100 to get it three days early for the game's basic release on December 8. Official review embargos are expected to lift later today at 4 PM PT / 7 PM ET, the same time as the early access.

What we do know from the game is that Indy has split from his on-and-off-again companion, Marion Ravenwood, and finds himself on the trail of a great conspiracy that leads him through the Vatican, the Sukhothai temples in Thailand, the Egyptian pyramids, Shanghai, and the icy Himalayas.

Game Pass users can upgrade to the Premium Edition for $35 (or $100 for those buying the full game without Game Pass) to play early and score a few bonuses like a Temple of Doom outfit and a future story DLC, the Order of the Giants. PlayStation owners will have to wait a bit longer to punch Nazis and seek treasure as the game isn't headed to the console until Spring 2025. item.title: Xbox May Have Saved This Guy's Life After He Was Hit By A Truck
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-may-have-saved-this-guys-life-after-he-was-hit-by-a-truck/1100-6528254/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

An Xbox fan has shared a harrowing story of how they were hit by a truck and dragged under it, and how the Xbox in his backpack helped prevent his head from pounding the pavement.

Brandon J on social media shared his scary story this week, recalling how he was riding his bike home from GameStop with a new Xbox Series S in his backpack. He was hit by a truck and ultimately pulled under it as the driver kept going. "The Xbox in my backpack prevented me from hitting my head or worse, even dying. I wasn't gonna get shredded beneath the truck so I used my left leg to attempt to slow the truck," Brandon wrote.

"At this point my bike wedged my right leg so I couldn’t move it anywhere. Next thing I know my backpack was only hanging on by my left shoulder and was slammed into the curb along with me afterwards."

After this, Brandon said he felt the full weight of the front end of the truck begin to roll onto his ribs, going on to say he was dragged for about 12 feet. He was taken to the hospital and miraculously only had a single broken bone in his left foot, in addition to some road rash. Not only was Brandon mostly OK from the experience, but his Xbox didn't break either. He said it booted up normally and runs games despite the toll it took and the damage it sustained.

"If the Xbox wasn’t in my bag at the time a lot more could have happened…" he wrote. Brandon also shared a number of images to demonstrate the damage.

This Console Saved My Life Guys… #Xbox #XboxSeriesS

I was on my way home from my local GameStop with the Xbox in my backpack when I was struck by a truck while riding my bicycle. I managed to keep above the trucks steel bumper at first but I eventually was dragged under.
I… pic.twitter.com/g089Cxm0W6

— Brandon J (@Jonzey8828) December 4, 2024

This story caught the attention of Microsoft, and marketing boss Aaron Greenberg said the Xbox team is sending Brandon a new console. "Rest up and be grateful for every day we have here together," Greenberg said. The official Xbox account also replied to Brandon, saying, "We're so glad that you're safe and hope the recovery is going well."
